alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:48AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, central Laurel, Pulaski and Rockcastle Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 448 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Woodstock to 8 miles west of Cains Store. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Woodstock, Bandy and Hogue around 455 AM EDT. Science Hill, Dabney, Bobtown, Valley Oak and Faubush around 500 AM EDT. Shopville, Naomi and Somerset Pulaski Airport around 505 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Somerset, Grade, Ruth, Steubenville, Dykes, Bent, Mill Springs, Elihu, Monticello, Mount Victory, Betsey, Cooper, Sloans Valley and Delta. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 1. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 40 and 66. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
